column2: The Treasure-hunt--The Voice Among the Trees
column3: The Treasure hunt-The Voice Among the Trees

column2: The plateau being somewhat tilted towards the west, this spot on which we had paused commanded a wide prospect on either hand.
column3: The plateau being somewhat tilted towards the west, this spot on which we had paused commanded a wide prospect on either hand.

column2: There was no sound but that of the distant breakers, mounting from all round, and the chirp of countless insects in the brush.
column3: There was no sound but that of the distant breakers, mounting from all round, and the chirp of countless insects in the brush.

column2: Not a man, not a sail, upon the sea; the very largeness of the view increased the sense of solitude.
column3: Not a man, not a sail, upon the sea; the very largeness of the view increased the sense of solitude.

column2: Silver, as he sat, took certain bearings with his compass.
column3: Silver, as he sat, took certain bearings with his compass.

column2: There are three 'tall trees' said he, "about in the right line from Skeleton Island. 'Spy-glass shoulder,' I take it, means that lower p'int there.
column3: There are three 'tall trees' said he, "about in the right line from Skeleton Island. 'Spy glass shoulder,' I take it, means that lower p'int there.

column2: It's child's play to find the stuff now.
column3: It's child's play to find the stuff now.

column2: Blue!	Blue!
Well, I reckon he was blue.
column3: Well, I reckon he was blue.

column2: The colour went from their six faces like enchantment; some leaped to their feet, some clawed hold of others; Morgan grovelled on the ground.
column3: The colour went from their six faces like enchantment; some leaped to their feet, some clawed hold of others; Morgan grovelled on the ground.

column2: It's Flint, by ----! cried Merry.
column3: It's Flint, by ----! cried Merry.

column2: The song had stopped as suddenly as it began--broken off, you would have said, in the middle of a note, as though someone had laid his hand upon the singer's mouth.
column3: The song had stopped as suddenly as it began-broken off, you would have said, in the middle of a note, as though someone had laid his hand upon the singer's mouth.

column2: Come, said Silver, struggling with his ashen lips to get the word out; "this won't do.
column3: Come, said Silver, struggling with his ashen lips to get the word out; "this won't do.

column2: Stand by to go about.
column3: Stand by to go about.

column2: His courage had come back as he spoke, and some of the colour to his face along with it.
column3: His courage had come back as he spoke, and some of the colour to his face along with it.

column2: Already the others had begun to lend an ear to this encouragement and were coming a little to themselves, when the same voice broke out again--not this time singing, but in a faint distant hail that echoed yet fainter among the clefts of the Spy-glass.
column3: Already the others had begun to lend an ear to this encouragement and were coming a little to themselves, when the same voice broke out again-not this time singing, but in a faint distant hail that echoed yet fainter among the clefts of the Spy glass.

column2: Darby M'Graw, it wailed--for that is the word that best describes the sound--"Darby M'Graw!
column3: Darby M'Graw, it wailed-for that is the word that best describes the sound-"Darby M'Graw!

column2: That fixes it! gasped one.
column3: That fixes it! gasped one.

column2: Let's go.
column3: Let's go.

column2: Still Silver was unconquered.
column3: Still Silver was unconquered.

column2: I could hear his teeth rattle in his head, but he had not yet surrendered.
column3: I could hear his teeth rattle in his head, but he had not yet surrendered.

column2: Don't you cross a sperrit.
column3: Don't you cross a sperrit.

column2: And the rest were all too terrified to reply.
column3: And the rest were all too terrified to reply.

column2: They would have run away severally had they dared; but fear kept them together, and kept them close by John, as if his daring helped them.
column3: They would have run away severally had they dared; but fear kept them together, and kept them close by john, as if his daring helped them.

column2: He, on his part, had pretty well fought his weakness down.
column3: He, on his part, had pretty well fought his weakness down.

column2: Sperrit?	Sperrit?
But there's one thing not clear to me. There was an echo.	But there's one thing not clear to me. There was an echo.
That ain't in natur', surely?"
column3: That ain't in natur', surely?"

column2: But you can never tell what will affect the superstitious, and to my wonder, George Merry was greatly relieved.
column3: But you can never tell what will affect the superstitious, and to my wonder, George Merry was greatly relieved.

column2: Well, that's so, he said.
column3: Well, that's so, he said.

column2: 'Bout ship, mates!
column3: 'bout ship, mates!

column2: Ben Gunn it were!
column3: Ben Gunn it were!

column2: It don't make much odds, do it, now? asked Dick.
column3: It don't make much odds, do it, now? asked Dick.

column2: Ben Gunn's not here in the body any more'n Flint.
column3: Ben Gunn's not here in the body any more'n Flint.

column2: Soon they were chatting together, with intervals of listening; and not long after, hearing no further sound, they shouldered the tools and set forth again, Merry walking first with Silver's compass to keep them on the right line with Skeleton Island.
column3: Soon they were chatting together, with intervals of listening; and not long after, hearing no further sound, they shouldered the tools and set forth again, Merry walking first with Silver's compass to keep them on the right line with Skeleton Island.

column2: He had said the truth: dead or alive, nobody minded Ben Gunn.
column3: He had said the truth: dead or alive, nobody minded Ben Gunn.

column2: Dick alone still held his Bible, and looked around him as he went, with fearful glances; but he found no sympathy, and Silver even joked him on his precautions.
column3: Dick alone still held his Bible, and looked around him as he went, with fearful glances; but he found no sympathy, and Silver even joked him on his precautions.

column2: Not that!" and he snapped his big fingers, halting a moment on his crutch.
column3: Not that!" and he snapped his big fingers, halting a moment on his crutch.

column2: But Dick was not to be comforted; indeed, it was soon plain to me that the lad was falling sick; hastened by heat, exhaustion, and the shock of his alarm, the fever, predicted by Dr. Livesey, was evidently growing swiftly higher.
column3: But Dick was not to be comforted; indeed, it was soon plain to me that the lad was falling sick; hastened by heat, exhaustion, and the shock of his alarm, the fever, predicted by dr Livesey, was evidently growing swiftly higher.

column2: The first of the tall trees was reached, and by the bearings proved the wrong one.
column3: The first of the tall trees was reached, and by the bearings proved the wrong one.

column2: So with the second.
column3: So with the second.

column2: It was conspicuous far to sea both on the east and west and might have been entered as a sailing mark upon the chart.
column3: It was conspicuous far to sea both on the east and west and might have been entered as a sailing mark upon the chart.

column2: Silver hobbled, grunting, on his crutch; his nostrils stood out and quivered; he cursed like a madman when the flies settled on his hot and shiny countenance; he plucked furiously at the line that held me to him and from time to time turned his eyes upon me with a deadly look. Certainly he took no pains to hide his thoughts, and certainly I read them like print.
column3: Silver hobbled, grunting, on his crutch; his nostrils stood out and quivered; he cursed like a madman when the flies settled on his hot and shiny countenance; he plucked furiously at the line that held me to him and from time to time turned his eyes upon me with a deadly look. Certainly he took no pains to hide his thoughts, and certainly I read them like print.

column2: Huzza, mates, all together! shouted Merry; and the foremost broke into a run.
column3: Huzza, mates, all together! shouted Merry; and the foremost broke into a run.

column2: And suddenly, not ten yards further, we beheld them stop.
column3: And suddenly, not ten yards further, we beheld them stop.

column2: A low cry arose.
column3: A low cry arose.

column2: Silver doubled his pace, digging away with the foot of his crutch like one possessed; and next moment he and I had come also to a dead halt.
column3: Silver doubled his pace, digging away with the foot of his crutch like one possessed; and next moment he and I had come also to a dead halt.

column2: Before us was a great excavation, not very recent, for the sides had fallen in and grass had sprouted on the bottom.
column3: Before us was a great excavation, not very recent, for the sides had fallen in and grass had sprouted on the bottom.

column2: In this were the shaft of a pick broken in two and the boards of several packing-cases strewn around.
column3: In this were the shaft of a pick broken in two and the boards of several packing cases strewn around.

column2: On one of these boards I saw, branded with a hot iron, the name WALRUS--the name of Flint's ship.
column3: On one of these boards I saw, branded with a hot iron, the name WALRUS-the name of Flint's ship.

column2: All was clear to probation.
